intro: Spilanthes iolepis, commonly known as the narrowleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellow flowers. Spilanthes iolepis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. It produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
